game.name: Star Wars - Jedi Academy (MP)
game.desc: Star Wars Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy is a 2003 first- and third-person shooter action video game set in the Star Wars universe, and is the final entry in the Star Wars: Jedi Knight game series..

game.name: Star Wars - Jedi Academy (SP)
game.desc: Star Wars Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy is a 2003 first- and third-person shooter action video game set in the Star Wars universe, and is the final entry in the Star Wars: Jedi Knight game series..

game.name: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
game.desc: Return to Castle Wolfenstein is a first-person shooter video game published by Activision, released on November 19, 2001.The game serves as both a remake and a reboot to the Wolfenstein series.

game.name: Cave Story
game.desc: Cave Story (doukutsu monogatari) is a Freeware Platform-Adventure Video Game Released in 2004 for the PC. It was developed over 5 years by Daisuke "Pixel" Amaya in his free time. It is one of the greatest most beautifully crafted games, particularly because of its compelling plot and musical genius.

game.name: Duke it out in D.C.
game.desc: This is an add-on episode for Duke Nukem 3D.Aliens have captured the President! Duke gets word that alien scum have landed in Washington D.C., laid it to waste, and imprisoned the leader of the free world. Always up for a heroic deed, Duke heads to D.C. to rid the city of enemy dirtbags and return the president to power!Includes 9 new levels plus one secret level. Works with Duke 3D v1.3d or newer, and Duke Atomic.

game.name: Duke Nukem 3D
game.desc: Duke Nukem 3D is a First Person Shooter game developed by 3D Realms in 1996.

game.name: Quake Episode 5 (dopa)
game.desc: Quake expansion Episode 5 dopa! NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: Quake Mission Pack 1 (hipnotic)
game.desc: Quake Mission Pack 1 (hipnotic)! NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: Quake Mission Pack 2 (rogue)
game.desc: Quake Mission Pack 2 (rogue)! NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: C Dogs
game.desc: Open source, classic overhead run-and-gun game. Customize your player and choose from up to 11 weapons.

game.name: Doom II
game.desc: Doom II original from PC edition!

game.name: Commander Genius
game.desc:
Commander Keen was a video game series originally on DOS. By default the emulator comes with 3 Commander Keen games, follow the file format of the games that are there when adding new games. You can then select them from the Commander Genius Launch Menu.
The included games are: Episode 1: Marooned on Mars Episode 2: The Earth Explodes Episode 3: Keen Must Die!

game.name: Duke Caribbean: Life's a Beach
game.desc: Aliens have set up a new breeding ground in the Caribbean, terrorising the islands. Duke, being on vacation, quickly responds to the situation. Players once again take the role of Duke Nukem through one new episode set in the hot Caribbean, destroying the aliens who wrecked his vacation.

game.path: ./Hexen II Mission Pack - Portal of Praevus.lnk
game.name: Hexen II Mission Pack: Portal of Praevus
game.image: ./mixart/Hexen II Mission Pack - Portal of Praevus.png
game.video: ./snap/Hexen II Mission Pack - Portal of Praevus.mp4
game.marquee: ./wheel/Hexen II Mission Pack - Portal of Praevus.png

game.name: Hurrican
game.desc: Hurrican a Turrican remake with HD enhancements!

game.path: ./Solarus Engine - Zelda Mystery of Solarus DX.lnk
game.name: Zelda Mystery of Solarus DX
game.desc:
The Legend of Zelda: Mystery of Solarus DX is set to be a direct sequel to The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past on the SNES, using the same graphics and game mechanisms. Zelda Mystery of Solarus DX is the first game made with the Solarus engine and in fact, Solarus was primarily designed for this game.
NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.path: ./Solarus Engine - Zelda Mystery of Solarus XD.lnk
game.name: Zelda Mystery of Solarus XD
game.desc:
Zelda Mystery of Solarus XD is a parodic game that we released on April 1st, 2011. Though it's a big April 1st joke, it's a real, full game with two huge dungeons and 5-10 hours of playing.
NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: The Ur-quan Masters
game.desc: n 1990, Toys for Bob released a simple multiplayer space battle game called Star Control. In 1992, it birthed a sequel, Star Control 2, an MS-DOS space exploration adventure of dizzying scope. Ten years later, the creators made the source code of the 3DO version available as open source. Another nine years passed, and the game was reborn as The Ur-Quan Masters, a non-commercial PC recreation of the original game for a new generation.

game.name: The Elder Scrolls - Daggerfall
game.desc: Daggerfall is a sequel to The Elder Scrolls: Arena; it is set in the same medieval fantasy world Tamriel - more specifically, in the homeland of the Breton race, known as High Rock, and the province Hammerfell, home of the Redguards. The game's title is derived from the name of High Rock's capital city. The main protagonist travels to Daggerfall at the request of the emperor Uriel Septim. His mission involves freeing the ghost of the late King Lysandus. Like its predecessor, Daggerfall is an open-ended role-playing game, in which the main quest is but a small fraction of the various missions and assignments the player is able to undertake. The game is notable for breaking records concerning the size of its world (though much of it has been generated randomly). Interaction with hundreds of thousands of non-playable characters is possible.

game.name: Doom I
game.desc: The Ultimate Doom I edition!

game.name: Star Wars - Tie Fighter Total Conversion
game.desc: Star Wars - X-Wing Alliance re-imagined/enhanced (fanmade)! Out of countless Star Wars video games, 1994’s TIE Fighter remains a beloved classic, throwing you into the titular Imperial starfighters and letting you blast away at rebels, pirates, and traitors. Twenty-five years later, a new fan mod has fully updated TIE Fighter with new graphics, widescreen support, new missions, and more. The result is an updated game that, as the mod team puts it, imagines “how TIE Fighter could've been had the technology of the time not limited it.”

game.name: 'H'Streets of Rage Remake
game.desc: Street of Rage Remake 5.2. Streets of Rage Remake (also known as Bare Knuckle Remake) is a mind-blowing SOR fangame, released by Bombergames in 2011 on the Microsoft Windows platform. It is designed as a remake of the original Sega Genesis trilogy, though in some ways it can be seen as a true sequel to SOR3.

game.name: 'H'Brutal Doom
game.desc: Doom on Steroids!

game.name: Half-Life
game.desc: Deep in the bowels of the Black Mesa Federal Research Facility, a decommissioned missile base, a top-secret experiment goes terribly wrong. As aliens come through the walls and a military death squad shoots everything in sight, young research associate Gordon Freeman must scramble to stay alive. Find your way through the monster-ridden areas of Black Mesa using your wits, limited security clearance, and a variety of weapons, ranging from a crowbar and pistols to a rocket launcher and grenades. With split-screen deathmatch and its exclusive "Decay" single-player and multiplayer cooperative modes, Half-Life is an action experience like no other.

game.name: CannonBall: The Enhanced OutRun
game.desc: Cannonball is an enhanced version of Sega’s classic 1986 game Outrun available for Windows, Mac OS, Linux, Pandora and Android. Although it requires the same ROMs that popular arcade emulators use to play the game, this is no mere emulator. Cannonball is a complete re-write of the game engine which adds a variety of enhancements such as true widescreen support, high-resolution graphics with improved sprite scaling, several bug fixes, additional view modes and support for both analog and digital gamepads.

game.name: 'H'Brutal Wolfenstein 3D
game.desc: Wolfenstein 3-D on Steroids!

game.name: Wolfenstein 3D
game.desc:
Wolfenstein ID Software First Person Shooter series originally developed for the PC by Id Software.
The source code to the original Quake engine was released under the GPLv2 license on December 21st 1999. This has enabled a wide variety of source ports and improvements to be made and for the game to run on alternative operating systems and architectures.

game.name: Rockin'Bliss!
game.desc: **VMAN's ROCKIN'BLISS SEPERATE BUILD REQUIRED** - Combined Guitar Hero + Rock Band = Rockin'Bliss! This is powered by Clone-Hero with Virtualman's customization to give you the best Rocking Rhythm gaming experience on earth! Play with your friends local or online with over 4000+ songs from VMAN's official song pack!.

game.name: Quake
game.desc:
Quake was a First Person Shooter series originally developed for the PC by Id Software. It is a successor to the Doom Series.
There are 4 Quake games: Quake, Quake II, and Quake III Arena and Quake 4. RetroPie includes Quake, TyrQuake (an optimized build of the original Quake Engine), and Quake III Arena.
The source code to the original Quake engine was released under the GPLv2 license on December 21st 1999. This has enabled a wide variety of source ports and improvements to be made and for the game to run on alternative operating systems and architectures.

game.path: ./Solarus Engine - Zelda Return of the Hylian SE.lnk
game.name: Zelda Return of the Hylian SE
game.desc:
Zelda Return of the Hylian SE. Zelda Return of the Hylian Solarus Edition is a remake of the original Zelda Return of the Hylian, a short but pleasant fangame from Vincent Jouillat.
After Link's victory over Ganon (in "A Link to the Past"), no one knows what Link's wish to the Triforce was. But this wish reunified the Light World and the Dark World and brought the 7 wise men's descendants back to life. Peace was back in Hyrule. But unfortunately, this wish also resurrected Ganon .
NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: Super Mario War
game.desc: Super Mario War is an open-source, cross-platform, platform-adventure video game and level editor released on December 16, 2006. It is based upon gameplay elements and audiovisual media that are cloned from Nintendo's Super Mario series.

game.name: SuperTuxKart
game.desc: SuperTuxKart is a Free 3d kart racing game; we want to make the game fun more than we want to make it realistic. You can play with up to 4 friends on one PC, racing against each other or just try to beat the computer. (a network multiplayer feature is planned) See the great lighthouse or drive through the sand and visit the pyramids. Race underground or in space, watching the stars passing by. Have some rest under the palms on the beach (watching the other karts overtaking you :) ). But don't eat the bananas! Watch for bowling balls, plungers, bubble gum and cakes thrown by opponents. You can do a single race against other karts, compete in one of several Grand Prix, try to beat the high score in time trials on your own, play battle mode against your friends, and more!

game.name: 'H'Wolfenstein 3D Coop
game.desc: 4 player Wolfenstein 3D, custom mod with splitscreen support for pure coop fun. Aka Splitwolf - Wolfenstein ID Software First Person Shooter series originally developed for the PC by Id Software.

game.name: 'H'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles HD
game.desc: WIP - Fanmade TMNT HD remastered is an action fanmade game. Do you remenber this wonderfull game? This is a fan remaster, made with love and passion. Its not 100% clone of the original arcade, but im almost there ^_^.

game.name: 'H'GoldenEye 007 XBLA
game.desc: **DX12 SUPPORTED VIDEO CARD REQUIRED - LONG BOOT IS NORMAL!**. After 13 years of it appearing briefly on Microsofts PartnerNet service, Goldeneye 007 XBLA on the Xbox 360 has leaked. The name is Bond. James Bond. The famous hero of Ian Fleming's novels returns in this first-person shooter, which is based on the movie of the same name. Agent 007 and his friend Alec Trevalyan (a.k.a. Agent 006) were sent to Soviet Union on a secret mission. But everything goes wrong, James Bond barely escapes, and his friend is presumed dead. Ten years later, a mysterious organization named "Janus" appeared. Commanding a new satellite called "GoldenEye", the organizations attempts to steal money electronically from banks, deleting all evidence of transfer. It's up to our Agent 007 to venture to Soviet Union once again, and to put an end to Janus' ambitions. In this 3D action game, you control James Bond from a first-person perspective, using a variety of weapons (from knuckles to grenade launcher) to eliminate your foes. However, many parts require you to be careful, to stay unnoticed or to snipe guards from distance, since they will react to your presence and alarm their comrades. The game is divided into missions, and in some of them you'll have to perform other tasks besides killing your enemies: disarm bombs, take pictures of important evidence, or avoid killing scientists. The game features a multiplayer mode with a variety of options, and three difficulty levels.

game.name: 'H'The Last StarFighter
game.desc: This is a fan-made game based on the arcade game that was seen in the movie. It's partially 1984 since the voice and sound sample was taken from the game that was used in the movie. it's partially 2006 since the game was recreated with the it's graphics looking so similar to the one seen in the movie. The only difference in the games are the fonts of the text in this recreated game and the graphics either look like flat-shaded or textured polygons. For the 3rd time, I finally beaten Ko-Dan Command Ship. I had to mess with the dip switch settings. It's very similar to what you see in the movie. After watching the movie, it made me feel want to play this game again. This game was ported to the home systems such as Atari 8-bit, Commodore 64, and the NES. But they look nothing like the arcade version. This freeware game is the closest to the arcade version you see in the movie.

game.name: Marble Man: Marble Madness II
game.desc: Marble Man: Marble Madness II was a cancelled arcade game planned for release in 1991 as the sequel to the 1984 arcade game Marble Madness. Mark Cerny, the creator of the original Marble Madness, wasn't involved with the development of the sequel. Development was instead led by Bob Flanagan who designed the game based on what he felt made Marble Madness a success in the home console market. Because the market's demographic was a younger audience, Flanagan wanted to make the sequel more accessible and introduced "Marble Man". The design also included pinball mini-games between sets of levels and allowed up to three players to traverse isometric courses. The final wave is called "King of the Mountain". Flanagan intended to address the short length of the first game and, with the help of Mike Hally, developed seventeen courses. The game was cancelled and the focus shifted to the development of Guardians of the 'Hood, a beat 'em up game released in 1992. No boards of the game were made apart from the prototypes, and according to Cerny, at most 12 of these exist. These prototypes have since become collector items.

game.name: 'H'Mushroom Kingdom Fusion
game.desc: Mushroom Kingdom Fusion (also known as MKFusion and MKF) is a fan base made game with modified Mario gameplay, crossed over with many different video game universes and elements. A roster of playable characters, both from within the Mario universe and outside of the Mario universe. Each character will have their own unique powerup system and gameplay mechanics, adapted to fit within the Mario-based gameplay.

game.name: Jazz Jackrabbit OpenJAZZ
game.desc: OpenJazz. is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games. OpenJazz can compiled for RPI4 and looks great 1080p 3x scale, implemented and tested by VMAN!

game.name: Duke: Nuclear Winter
game.desc: This is an authorized add-on pack for Duke Nukem 3D. It adds 7 new maps to the game which put the player to North Pole. Here he must battle alien scum to help Santa Claus survive. The pack also adds new special arctic monsters and new artwork to the game.

game.name: 3DSen
game.desc: 3dSen PC breathes new life into your favorite NES games by magically converting them into 3D and letting you play them in real-time.

game.name: SoH - Zelda OoT
game.desc: Welcome to the Ship of Harkinian! A PC port of The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time allowing you to enjoy the game with modern controls, widescreen, high-resolution, gyroscopy and other great features!

game.name: 'H'AM2R Another Metroid 2 Remake
game.desc: Fanmade AM2R is an action-adventure game developed by Argentinian programmer Milton Guasti and released on August 6, 2016, Metroid's 30th anniversary. It was originally released for Windows. It is an unofficial remake of the 1991 Game Boy game Metroid II: Return of Samus in the style of Metroid: Zero Mission.

game.name: Contra: Evolution
game.desc:
In 2631, a meteorite strikes the Galuga archipelago near New Zealand, carrying with it a dormant alien being. Two years later, a terrorist organization calling themselves Red Falcon takes over the island as part of their plot to invade the Earth. Bill Rizer and Lance Bean, of the Contra unit, are sent to the Oceania island to stop the evil threat.
'Contra' is a hectic one or two player platform shoot-em-up featuring 10 stages. In addition to the standard side-view levels, there are also "3D maze" stages in which the player must proceed through a series of corridors inside an enemy base, destroying various sensors, in order to reach the core of the base.
Each player's character is equipped with a semi-automatic machine gun with an unlimited amount of ammunition and can jump, move and fire in all eight cardinal directions. Players can also move and jump simultaneously while firing. Co-ordination of the character's movement is essential as a single hit from any enemy, bullet, or other hazard will instantly kill the player's character and also eliminate the current weapon from the player's inventory.
